content: sts knitwise then knit them together st s = stitch es ws = wrong side 2 pattern cast on 96 sts in contrast color i used long-tail cast on place marker and join in the round ribbing work 3 rounds of k2 p2 ribbing in the contrast color switch to green and knit one round this prevents icky dots in the ribbing at the color change then continue in k2 p2 ribbing until ribbing measures 2 75 /7cm from cast on next round k 47 sts p1 place marker k to 1 st before beginning of round marker p1 if you added or subtracted sets of 4 sts to make the hat bigger or smaller divide the number of sts you added by 2 and add or subtract that from 47 for example if you added 8 sts to the cast on you would add 4 sts to 47 so the instruction would be k 51 sts p1 … hat body round 1 *knit until 1 stitch before m p1 sm repeat from * once more repeat this round for 2 5 /6 3cm hat will be approximately 5 25 /13 3cm from cast on if you want the hat to come down farther over your ears or if are making this hat for a larger head more than 22 /56cm add some length here before starting the decreases add approximately ¾ /2cm of length per extra inch of width of the head decrease rounds round 1 decrease *ssk k until 3 sts before m k2tog p1 sm repeat from * once more 4 sts decreased round 2 *knit until 1 stitch before m p1 sm repeat from * once more round 3 decrease repeat round 1 round 4 decrease repeat round 1 round 5 decrease repeat round 1 round 6 extra decrease *sl2-k1-p2sso k to 4 sts before m k3tog p1 sm repeat from * once more 8 sts decreased round 7 repeat round 2 round 8 decrease repeat round 1 round 9 extra decrease repeat round 6 rounds 10-13 repeat round 2 no decreases round 14 extra decrease repeat round 6 3 finish the hat by turning it inside out and doing a 3-needle bind off alternatively you can bind off and sew the seam together finishing eyes cut 2 circles 3 /7 5cm diameter in white felt cut 2 circles 1 /2 5cm diameter in black felt optional add a couple strips of clear packing tape to the back of the white felt this gives a little extra structure and keeps the eyes from being floppy tape the pupil to the eyeball using tape position the eyes until you are happy with the placement try on the hat to test stuffing a couple wads of paper towel into the cheeks if desired it looks a little different when worn than when lying flat once you are happy with the placement sew on the eyes with a sharp stout needle and black thread tip punching through multiple layers
